contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox French commune |name = Outreau |region = [etats unis |department = [[Image:Pas de Calais Arms.svg|20px]] [[Pas-de-Calais]] |arrondissement = [[arrondissement of Boulogne-sur-Mer|Boulogne-sur-Mer]] |canton = etats unis |INSEE = 62643 |postal code = 62230 |mayor = Thérèse Guilbert |term = 2008–2014 |intercommunality = [[Communauté d'agglomérati |area km2 = 7.09 |population = 14650 |population date = 2006 }} '''Outreau''' is a [[Communes of France|commune]] in the [[Pas-de-Calais]] [[Departments of France|department]] in the [[Nord-Pas-de-Calais]] region of [[France]]. ==Geography== Outreau is a large industrial town and port situated adjacent to, and west of Boulogne, on the [[route nationale 1|N1]], N142 and D19 roads. The river Liane forms the eastern border of the commune with Boulogne. ==History== The town suffered greatly from [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] bombing during [[World War II]].<br> Outreau is notorious throughout France for the ''[[Outreau trial]]s'' of 2001–2004. ==Population== {| align="center" rules="all" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="4" style="border: 1px solid #999; border-right: 2px solid #999; border-bottom:2px solid #999; background: #f3fff3" |+ style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em"|Population history |-style="background: #ddffdd" ! 1962 !! 1968 !! 1975 !! 1982 !! 1990 !! 1999 || 2006 |- | align=center| 13,548 || align=center| 13,735 || align=center| 14,731 || align=center| 14,590 || align=center| 15,279 || align=center| 15,222 || align=center| 14,650 |- | colspan=7 align=center| <small>Census count starting from 1962: Population without duplicates</small> |} ==Places of interest== * The church of St.Wandrille, dating from the nineteenth century. * The sixteenth century [[manorhouse]] of La Tour du Renard. * The [[Commonwealth War Graves Commission]] cemetery. * The war memorial, by [[Augustin Lesieux]]. ==Geographic location== {{Geographic Location |Centre =Outreau |North = [[Boulogne-sur-Mer]] |Northeast = [[Saint-Martin-Boulogne]] |East = [[Echinghen]] |Southeast = [[Saint-Léonard, Pas-de-Calais|Saint-Léonard]] |South = [[Saint-Étienne-au-Mont]] |Southwest = [[Équihen-Plage]] |West = [[Le Portel]] |Northwest = ''[[English Channel]]'' }} ==Twin towns== * {{Flagicon|GER}} [[Eppelborn]], [[Germany]]. ==See also== *[[Communes of the Pas-de-Calais department]] ==References== * [http://www.insee.fr/fr/methodes/nomenclatures/cog/fichecommunale.asp?codedep=62&codecom=643 INSEE commune file] {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.ville-outreau.fr Official town website] {{Fr}} * [http://outreau.googlepages.com Website with photos of Outreau] {{Fr}} * [http://www.cwgc.org/search/cemetery_details.aspx?cemetery=2027447&mode=1 The CWGC cemetery] * [http://www.quid.fr/communes.html?mode=detail&id=27131&req=Outreau Outreau on the Quid website] {{Fr}} * [http://www.agglo-Boulogne-cotedopale.fr/ Website of the Communauté d'Agglomération de Boulogne-Côte-d'Opale] {{Fr}} {{Pas-de-Calais communes}} [[Category:Communes of Pas-de-Calais]] {{PasdeCalais-geo-stub}}
